fields.description:
TestContainerManagerSecurity has been failing recently in 2.8:
{noformat}
Running org.apache.hadoop.yarn.server.TestContainerManagerSecurity
Tests run: 2, Failures: 1, Errors: 1, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 80.928 sec <<< FAILURE! - in org.apache.hadoop.yarn.server.TestContainerManagerSecurity
testContainerManager[0](org.apache.hadoop.yarn.server.TestContainerManagerSecurity)  Time elapsed: 44.478 sec  <<< ERROR!
java.lang.NullPointerException: null
	at org.apache.hadoop.yarn.server.TestContainerManagerSecurity.waitForContainerToFinishOnNM(TestContainerManagerSecurity.java:394)
	at org.apache.hadoop.yarn.server.TestContainerManagerSecurity.testNMTokens(TestContainerManagerSecurity.java:337)
	at org.apache.hadoop.yarn.server.TestContainerManagerSecurity.testContainerManager(TestContainerManagerSecurity.java:157)

testContainerManager[1](org.apache.hadoop.yarn.server.TestContainerManagerSecurity)  Time elapsed: 34.964 sec  <<< FAILURE!
java.lang.AssertionError: null
	at org.junit.Assert.fail(Assert.java:86)
	at org.junit.Assert.assertTrue(Assert.java:41)
	at org.junit.Assert.assertTrue(Assert.java:52)
	at org.apache.hadoop.yarn.server.TestContainerManagerSecurity.testNMTokens(TestContainerManagerSecurity.java:333)
	at org.apache.hadoop.yarn.server.TestContainerManagerSecurity.testContainerManager(TestContainerManagerSecurity.java:157)
{noformat}

comments.body:
git bisect points to this commit when it started failing in branch-2.8:
{noformat}
commit f9016dfec33f1d6486c03a54f0a479ed08aff34f
Author: Karthik Kambatla <kasha@cloudera.com>
Date:   Tue Sep 6 16:23:06 2016 -0700

    YARN-5566. Client-side NM graceful decom is not triggered when jobs finish. (Robert Kanter via kasha)
{noformat}
  [~rkanter] [~kasha] could you take a look?
Sure.  I'll take a look later today.

This only seems to be a problem in branch-2.8 and branch-2.  trunk seems to be fine.  However, I'm getting a different failure than you:
{noformat}
Running org.apache.hadoop.yarn.server.TestContainerManagerSecurity
Tests run: 2, Failures: 2, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 44.517 sec <<< FAILURE! - in org.apache.hadoop.yarn.server.TestContainerManagerSecurity
testContainerManager[0](org.apache.hadoop.yarn.server.TestContainerManagerSecurity)  Time elapsed: 23.939 sec  <<< FAILURE!
java.lang.AssertionError: null
       	at org.junit.Assert.fail(Assert.java:86)
       	at org.junit.Assert.assertTrue(Assert.java:41)
       	at org.junit.Assert.assertTrue(Assert.java:52)
       	at org.apache.hadoop.yarn.server.TestContainerManagerSecurity.testNMTokens(TestContainerManagerSecurity.java:360)
       	at org.apache.hadoop.yarn.server.TestContainerManagerSecurity.testContainerManager(TestContainerManagerSecurity.java:157)

testContainerManager[1](org.apache.hadoop.yarn.server.TestContainerManagerSecurity)  Time elapsed: 19.823 sec  <<< FAILURE!
java.lang.AssertionError: null
       	at org.junit.Assert.fail(Assert.java:86)
       	at org.junit.Assert.assertTrue(Assert.java:41)
       	at org.junit.Assert.assertTrue(Assert.java:52)
       	at org.apache.hadoop.yarn.server.TestContainerManagerSecurity.testNMTokens(TestContainerManagerSecurity.java:360)
       	at org.apache.hadoop.yarn.server.TestContainerManagerSecurity.testContainerManager(TestContainerManagerSecurity.java:157)
{noformat}
(The {{null}} is misleading and is because of a junit bug which happens when an {{assertTrue}} or {{assertFalse}} has no (optional) message)

The NPE looks like a case where either a container never started or completed and removed from the context before the test code tried to examine it.  waitForContainerToFinishOnNM blindly assumes the container is still in the context when it goes to check, and apparently it sometimes isn't there.  Across multiple invocations it sometimes encounters the NPE in the first testcase and other times the same assert as seen by the second testcase, so it's racy.

I figured out the problem.  It's because the test is creating an App, but not actually adding it to the RM, and with the YARN-5566 changes, that needs to be done in the code path that the test is using.  I had to make some similar fixes in some tests in YARN-5566.

This message was automatically generated.

+1 for the patch.  It fixes the problem introduced in YARN-5566, and we can address the other issues with this test in YARN-4342.  I updated the summary to better differentiate it from YARN-4342.

Committing this.
Thanks to [~rkanter] for the contribution and to [~templedf] for additional review!  I committed this to trunk, branch-2, and branch-2.8.

SUCCESS: Integrated in Jenkins build Hadoop-trunk-Commit #10466 (See [https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-trunk-Commit/10466/])
YARN-5655. TestContainerManagerSecurity#testNMTokens is asserting. (jlowe: rev c6d1d742e70e7b8f1d89cf9a4780657646e6a367)
* (edit) hadoop-yarn-project/hadoop-yarn/hadoop-yarn-server/hadoop-yarn-server-tests/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/yarn/server/TestContainerManagerSecurity.java
Thanks [~jlowe]!
[~rkanter], [~templedf], Looks like this still fails at times on trunk... can you take a look ?
[~asuresh], can you point me to an instance of it failing?  I just ran the test 100 times locally and it never failed.

My local branch is synched with trunk. Attaching output of:
$ mvn test -Dtest=TestContainerManagerSecurity

Can you please take another look? Thanks!
I'm also able to reproduce the NPE.  We'll take a look.

Actually, I'm able to reproduce the issue in the commit *before* this patch:

I'll run a bisect to see where the issue actually entered.
OK, this makes no sense whatsoever, but I have manually confirmed the results: the NPE is introduced in HDFS-9781.  Anyone want to double-check my results?
I was able to see the failure on the commit before HDFS-9781.
It looks like it would be YARN-5264 that broke it.
Any update on this ? I am seeing this error in trunk .
